summary: The Phoenix and the Flame - cecilantro - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Phoenix and the Flame - cecilantro - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Critical Role (Web Series)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Mollymauk Tealeaf/Caleb Widogast, Polynein (Critical Role)
Characters: Mollymauk Tealeaf, Caleb Widogast, Beauregard (Critical Role), Nott (Critical Role), Jester (Critical Role), Fjord (Critical Role), Yasha (Critical Role), Caduceus Clay, Keg (Critical Role), Calianna (Critical Role)
Additional Tags: Original Universe AU
Summary:

It’s just meant to be a journey of convenience across kingdoms, little bands of adventurers moving as a pack to ward off threats.
None of them had ever expected to care about their new companions. None of them expected to give up all of the things they’d set out to do.

None of them expected to die.

And none of them had expected the phoenix from the ashes, bringing them a new life as their old ones turn to dust behind them.

Have 48k of Aracanus AU

summary: Amusing things to consider: Nott is as smart as Percy. Both stats-wise (went up eventually but Percy was at Int 16 for a long...
body: Amusing things to consider: Nott is as smart as Percy. Both stats-wise (went up eventually but Percy was at Int 16 for a long time) and, I think, she’s actually shown it. Just less experienced, less wise, and significantly more drunk on average.

reblog.comment: Amusing things to consider: Nott is as smart as Percy. Both stats-wise (went up eventually but Percy was at Int 16 for a long time) and, I think, she’s actually shown it. Just less experienced, less wise, and significantly more drunk on average.

Jester just burned every spell of level two or higher, both of her channel divinities, like fifteen great dice rolls, and almost got herself and Nott arrested… all to paint a mustache on a platinum dragon statue

I think the Traveller is very proud

blog.name: bagoholding
blog.title: dungeons & dice
blog.description: my personal d&d related likes

summary: Learning a lesson? Never!
body:
Learning a lesson? Never!

Two players (Rogue and Monk) joined us and in their first game they conned a poor woman out of all her belongings, convincing her some ring we found cured all illnesses.


Weeks later in game, months later out of game, we are on a ship escorting important cargo for the duke and the Rogue is attacked in her sleep, nearly killing her. Turns out the poor woman died from her illness and her daughters were here for revenge. One is wearing the ring and it’s magic throws us all into our own worst nightmares.

I and the Ranger are appalled, Monk kills the sister and they both are demanding we kill the other one as well.

TLDR sometimes even if you give your players repurcussions for their shitty actions they still won’t care.

Weeks later in game, months later out of game, we are on a ship escorting important cargo for the duke and the Rogue is attacked in her sleep, nearly killing her. summary:
Keyleth: I'll touch Vex and cast dispel magic.... wait wait wait, take off all your magical items first!
Vex: All- everything...
body:
Keyleth: I'll touch Vex and cast dispel magic.... wait wait wait, take off all your magical items first!
Vex: All- everything I'm wearing is magic!
Keyleth: Well... take it off
Grog: YEAH!
Vex: [undressing, muttering] What IS it about Scanlan's mansion that makes us get naked all the time?

summary: The Sun Always Rises by tameila Pike leads her town’s Sarenrae parish, but a need for something more lies deep within her heart....
caption:
The Sun Always Rises

by tameila

Pike leads her town’s Sarenrae parish, but a need for something more lies deep within her heart. Scanlan’s a disillusioned pop star searching for some semblance of purpose or - well…anything. They may be exactly what the other needs. If only they could figure out themselves enough to realize it.

this chapter: In the aftermath, Pike learns to rebuild. [roadtrip, part one]

[slow burn Pikelan with established Perc’ahlia and background Grogleth]
